DOC.brief_summary: The main objectives of this study are to evaluate the safety and performance of the AutoLap system in Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy procedures.
DOC.brief_title: Safety and Performance Evaluation of the AutoLap System
DOC.criteria: 1. Signed and dated Informed Consent Form. 2. Patients between 18 and 75 years of age inclusive who were scheduled for elective laparoscopic Cholecystectomy procedure. 1. Previous upper abdominal surgery and contraindications to Pneumoperitoneum. 2. Pregnancy. 3. Obesity (BMI >35 Kg/m2). 4. Generalized peritonitis. 5. Septic shock from cholangitis. 6. Severe acute pancreatitis. 7. Uncorrected coagulopathy. 8. Previous abdominal operations which prevent safe abdominal access or progression of the procedure. 9. Advanced cirrhosis with failure of hepatic function. 10. Suspected gallbladder cancer. 11. Acute cholecystitis 12. Presence of any medical or psychiatric condition or any other condition that, in the opinion of the Investigator, could affect the successful participation of the patient in the study. 13. Patient participates in any other clinical study 60 days prior to the start of the study and throughout the study duration.
